content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Doable within the timeframe

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it's a good puzzle.... i think reverse mode is also good for this puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I approved this contribution because it's fun to do and a good exercise on digit manipulation.

I liked this task

It is better to replace the description with a more specific one, without unnecessary words and and unnecessary information, as they say in Russia "without water".

Goal
The sum of the unique digits (not numbers) in all the numbers.

Output
One integer: the sum of the unique digits in all numbers.

It would also be better to replace the Example with a more visual and simple one.

Input
2
13
14
Output
7

This task is well suited for reverse collision =)
Thanks for the feedback, it's my first one so I didn't know about formatting ! :)

Input
* Please delete "(1 ≤ N ≤ 100)" and "(1 ≤ X ≤ 10^9)".

* Please add "<<Line 1>>:" before "A single integer".

* Please change "N lines follow each containing an" to "<<Next [[N]] lines>>: An".

* Please format "N" and "X" as [[variables]].

Constraints
* Please format "N" and "X" as [[variables]].

* Please *either* change 100 to 10, *or* add some cases where 10 < N ≤ 100.

* Please *either* change 10^9 to 10^5, *or* add some cases where 10^5 ≤ X ≤ 10^9.

Cases
* Please change Validator 1 so that all digits are unique, e.g.

2
24689
1375

* Please change Test 4 by adding some zeros as digits, e.g. 98 may be changed to 908.

Stub generator
* Please change "string(10)" to "int".

Thanks.

No worries.

An additional tip for you: I'll receive a notification only if you reply to my messages directly ;)

"Спасибо за ваш отзыв"

I just made the changes, thank you :)

Perhaps it would be better to slightly adjust the description of the goal - to clearly indicate what needs to be done (action).

Goal
Calculate the sum of the unique digits (not numbers) in all the numbers.

Maybe the "Stub generator input" needs to be fixed (write 0 -> write 7, or other)
